skill.name: typescript-write
skill.description: Write TypeScript and JavaScript code following Metabase coding standards and best practices. Use when developing or refactoring TypeScript/JavaScript code.
skill.summary: Write TypeScript and JavaScript code following Metabase coding standards and best practices. Use whe...
skill.author: unknown

security_audit.summary: The skill contains only guidance text and references to shared documentation. No code execution, file access, or network behavior is present.

content.value_statement: You need consistent TypeScript and JavaScript code across a Metabase codebase. This skill guides refactors and new code with tested standards.
actual_capabilities: Guides TypeScript and JavaScript development or refactoring
Aligns code with Metabase coding standards
Suggests linting and type checking commands
limitations: Does not run commands or modify files
Does not cover languages beyond TypeScript and JavaScript
Does not provide project specific architecture details

use_cases.title: Refactor with standards
use_cases.description: Refactor a component while keeping Metabase style and testing workflow aligned.

use_cases.title: Add new feature code
use_cases.description: Draft TypeScript logic for a new feature with consistent patterns.

use_cases.title: Check standards alignment
use_cases.description: Review suggested changes for compliance with Metabase coding practices.

prompt_templates.title: Simple refactor
prompt_templates.prompt: Refactor this TypeScript file for clarity and Metabase standards. Explain the key changes and suggest related tests.

prompt_templates.title: Add feature logic
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft TypeScript code for a new UI behavior. Follow Metabase style and mention any lint or type checks to run.

prompt_templates.title: Test first plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose a test first approach for this behavior change in JavaScript, then outline the implementation steps.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced refactor plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a refactor plan for a legacy TypeScript module, prioritize risk reduction, and keep it compatible with Metabase standards.

output_examples.input: Refactor this component to reduce duplication and keep Metabase standards
output: Identified duplicated state handling and extracted a helper
Aligned naming with existing Metabase patterns
Suggested unit tests for the extracted helper

best_practices: Share existing code patterns before asking for changes
Request a test plan along with implementation steps
Run lint and type checks after applying changes
anti_patterns: Asking for changes without providing current code
Mixing unrelated refactors in one request

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with any TypeScript project
faq.answer: It is tuned for Metabase conventions but can guide general TypeScript work.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill
faq.answer: It provides guidance only and does not run code or access files.

faq.question: Can it integrate with CI or lint tools
faq.answer: It recommends commands but does not execute or configure integrations.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data
faq.answer: No. The skill content contains no data access or storage behavior.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot unclear results
faq.answer: Provide more code context and specify the expected behavior or test failures.

faq.question: How does it compare to a generic coding assistant
faq.answer: It focuses on Metabase standards and a test first development workflow.
